Franklin & Marshall

Fields of Study - A to Z

More than 60 fields of study

F&M provides room to explore your favorite subjects while discovering new ones, too. A key element of the liberal arts model encourages you to explore a variety of courses and disciplines before choosing a major. There’s even room to create your own interdisciplinary major.

Home / Academics /

The Connections Curriculum

The curriculum at F&M is called “Connections.” A true representation of a liberal arts education, our curriculum encourages you to strive beyond traditional boundaries and limits and make “connections”: connections between disciplines that on the surface don’t seem related, connections between theory and practice, connections with other students and faculty and connections between your liberal arts education and the world.

The Ampersand

Founded in 1787, Franklin & Marshall College is a residential college dedicated to excellence in undergraduate liberal education.
